question: Cavity fillings and sensitivity ?
question_content: a three days ago i got 2 fillings on the left bottom side one was deep they said and is really sensitive is this normal

answers.answer_content:
1. Sometimes this is just the consequence of a deep filling, and it should subside within a week.
2. If it is a white (composite) filling, then these are much more likely to give post-op pain than silver fillings. This is because they shrink (1-4%) upon setting, and can pull away from the floor or sides of the cavity. They need much more careful placement than amalgams to work properly.
If the pain continues for another couple of days, or if it is worsening, then ask to have the white filling replaced with an amalgam. It can also be helpful to swab the cavity floor with a corticosteroid eyewash before placing the lining.
Sometimes you just are unlucky, and the decay was so deep that the "nerve" in the tooth cannot recover. It will then require either a root canal therapy or extraction.

Yes, it is normal for a deep cavity.  Try brushing with sensodyne twice a day until the pain goes away. At that point you may be able to brush with regular toothpaste or you might still have to brush with sensodyne on a daily basis.
